sentence.Network_en: He had just arrived hotfoot from London.

sentence.Network_cn: 孩子们听说茶点已准备好了,便赶紧跑过来.

sentence.Network_en: Like Bernard Shaw, he has tickled his readers'funny bone with a cultural hotfoot.
sentence.Network_cn: 他和萧伯纳一样, 以文化觉醒来撩拨读者的兴趣.

RelatedPhrase.word: He hotfooted it out of town

list.key: He hotfooted it out of town
list.abs: 1) He hotfooted it out of town.他火急地出城去。2) He is hasty to catch the train. 他急于去赶火车。3) He was called out of town. 他被叫出城.
He hotfooted it out of town ., 他火急地出城去.

entry.def: If you hot-foot it somewhere, you go there in a hurry.

example.ex: ...a group of actors hot-footing it for the bar.
example.tran: 一群急匆匆赶往酒吧的演员

sentences.sentence: "He rushed down the hall to receive his guests"
"sent ambassadors hotfoot to the Turks"- Francis Hackett

auth_sentence.content: When we take the tunnel to Calais, we hotfoot out and make for the coast round Boulogne.

auth_sentence.content: His full-on attack lights a hotfoot under anyone else onstage, which guarantees considerable intensity.
